summary.long: Mark is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is how it is written in the prophet Isaiah:
Look, I am sending my messenger ahead of you,
who will prepare the way for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A voice of one calling out in the wilderness,
“Prepare the way of the Lord.
Make his paths straight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John appeared, baptizing in the wilderness and preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole Judean countryside and all the people of Jerusalem were going out to him. They were baptized by him in the Jordan River as they confessed their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John was clothed in camel’s hair, and he wore a leather belt around his waist. He ate locusts and wild honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He preached, “One more powerful than I is coming after me. I am not worthy to stoop down and untie the strap of his sandals!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I baptized you with water, but he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as Jesus came up out of the water, he saw the heavens being torn open and the Spirit descending on him like a dove.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a voice came from heaven: “You are my Son, whom I love. I am well pleased with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit immediately sent Jesus out into the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was in the wilderness for forty days, being tempted by Satan. He was with the wild animals, and angels were serving him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After John was put in prison, Jesus went to Galilee, preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The time is fulfilled,” he said. “The kingdom of God has come near! Repent, and believe in the gospel.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: As Jesus was going along the Sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and his brother Andrew casting a net into the sea, since they were fishermen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Come, follow me, and I will make you fishers of men.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Immediately they left their nets and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Going on a little farther, he saw James the son of Zebedee and his brother John. They were in a boat mending the nets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately Jesus called them. They left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired servants and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they went into Capernaum.
On the next Sabbath day, Jesus went into the synagogue and began to teach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were amazed at his teaching, because he was teaching them as one who has authority and not as the experts in the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just then there was a man with an unclean spirit in their synagogue. It cried out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What do we have to do with you, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus rebuked the spirit, saying, “Be quiet! Come out of him!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The unclean spirit threw the man into convulsions, and after crying out with a loud voice, it came out of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone was so amazed that they began to discuss this with each other. They said, “What is this? A new teaching with authority! He even commands the unclean spirits, and they obey him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: News about him spread quickly through all the region of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left the synagogue and went with James and John to the home of Simon and Andrew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon’s mother-in-law was lying in bed, sick with a fever. Without delay they told Jesus about her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went to her, took her by the hand, and raised her up. The fever left her, and she began to serve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That evening, when the sun had set, the people kept bringing to him all who were sick and demon-possessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole town gathered at the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He healed many people who were sick with various diseases and drove out many demons. But he did not allow the demons to speak, because they knew who he was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus got up early in the morning, while it was still dark, and went out. He withdrew to a solitary place and was praying there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon and his companions searched for him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and, when they found him, they said to him, “Everyone is looking for you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “Let’s go somewhere else, to the neighboring villages, so that I can preach there too. In fact, that is why I have come.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then he went throughout the whole region of Galilee, preaching in their synagogues and driving out demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A leper came to Jesus. He knelt down and begged him, “If you are willing, you can make me clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moved with compassion, Jesus stretched out his hand and touched him. “I am willing,” he told him. “Be clean.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Immediately the leprosy left him, and he was healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus gave him a stern warning and immediately sent him away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told him, “See that you do not say anything to anyone. Instead go, show yourself to the priest, and offer the sacrifices for your cleansing that Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But after the man left, he began to proclaim it widely. He spread the word so much that Jesus was no longer able to enter a town openly but stayed outside in deserted places. Yet people kept coming to him from all directions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus again entered Capernaum some days later, people heard that he was home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So many people were gathered together that there was no more room, not even by the door, and he was speaking the word to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some people came to him bringing a paralyzed man, carried by four men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since they could not bring the man to Jesus because of the crowd, they dug through the roof above where he was. When they had made an opening, they lowered the stretcher on which the paralyzed man was lying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralyzed man, “Son, your sins are forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But there were some experts in the law sitting there and thinking in their hearts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why does this fellow speak like this? He is blaspheming! Who can forgive sins except God alone?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus immediately knew in his spirit that they were thinking this way within themselves. He asked them, “Why are you thinking these things in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Which is easier: to tell the paralyzed man, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up, take your stretcher, and walk’?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But, so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins”—he said to the paralyzed man,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “I tell you, get up, take your stretcher, and go home.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: At once the man got up, picked up the stretcher, and went out in front of everyone. So they were all amazed and glorified God. They said, “We have never seen anything like this!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went out again along the sea. The whole crowd went to him, and he taught them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was passing by, he saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the tax booth. “Follow me,” Jesus told him. And Levi got up and followed him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then when Jesus was reclining at a table in Levi’s house, many tax collectors and sinners were reclining with Jesus and his disciples because many of them also were following him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the experts in the law and the Pharisees saw that he was eating with the sinners and tax collectors, they said to his disciples, “Why is he eating and drinking with tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard this, he said to them, “Those who are healthy do not need a physician, but the sick do. I did not come to call the righteous, but sinners.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting. They came and asked Jesus, “Why is it that John’s disciples and the Pharisees’ disciples fast, but your disciples do not fast?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “The friends of the bridegroom cannot fast while the bridegroom is with them, can they? As long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then on that day they will fast.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: No one sews a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment. Otherwise, the patch shrinks, the new tears away from the old, and a worse tear is made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one pours new wine into old wineskins. Otherwise, the new wine will burst the skins, the wine will pour out, and the skins will be ruined. Instead, new wine is poured into new wineskins.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Once on a Sabbath day, Jesus was passing through the grain fields, and his disciples began to pick heads of grain as they walked along.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees said to him, “Look, why are they doing what is not lawful on the Sabbath day?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He replied to them, “Have you never read what David did when he was in need and hungry (he and his companions)?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He entered the house of God in the time of Abiathar the high priest and ate the Bread of the Presence, which is not lawful for anyone to eat, except for the priests. He also gave some to his companions.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “The Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So the Son of Man is the Lord even of the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus entered the synagogue again, and a man was there with a withered hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were watching Jesus closely to see if he would heal the man on the Sabbath day, so that they could accuse him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the man with the withered hand, “Step forward!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “Is it lawful on the Sabbath day to do good or to do evil, to save life or to kill?” But they were silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he looked around at them with anger, deeply grieved at the hardness of their hearts. He said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” The man stretched it out, and his hand was restored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees left and immediately began to conspire against Jesus with the Herodians, plotting how they might kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus withdrew to the sea with his disciples. A large crowd followed him from Galilee, Judea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jerusalem, Idumaea, and beyond the Jordan, as well as from around Tyre and Sidon. A large crowd came to him when they heard all that he was doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told his disciples to have a boat ready for him because of the crowd, so that the people would not crush him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since he had healed many people, all those who had illnesses were pressing forward to touch him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever the unclean spirits saw him, they fell down in front of him, crying out, “You are the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he warned them sternly that they should not tell who he was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went up the mountain, summoned those he wanted, and they came to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He appointed twelve whom he designated apostles, so that they would be with him and so that he could send them out to preach
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to have authority to drive out demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He appointed the Twelve: Simon, to whom he gave the name Peter;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then James the son of Zebedee, and John the brother of James, to whom he gave the nickname Boanerges, which means “Sons of Thunder”;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also Andrew, Philip, Bartholomew, Matthew, Thomas, and James the son of Alphaeus; finally, Thaddaeus, Simon the Zealot,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Judas Iscariot, who betrayed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went into a house. A crowd gathered again so that they were not even able to eat a meal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When his own people heard this, they went out to take control of him, because they were saying, “He is out of his mind.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The experts in the law who came down from Jerusalem were saying, “He is possessed by Beelzebul,” and “He drives out demons by the ruler of demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called them together and spoke to them in parables. “How can Satan drive out Satan?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if Satan has risen up against himself and is divided, he cannot stand but is finished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the other hand, no one can enter a strong man’s house to steal his possessions unless he ties up the strong man first. Then he can plunder his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amen I tell you: Everything will be forgiven people, their sins and whatever blasphemies they may speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will never have forgiveness, but is guilty of an eternal sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said this because they were saying, “He has an unclean spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his mother and his brothers arrived. While they were standing outside, they sent word to Jesus, calling for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A crowd was sitting around him. They began to tell him, “Look, your mother and your brothers are outside looking for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He replied, “Who are my mother and my brothers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looked at those who sat around him in a circle and he said, “Look, my mother and my brothers!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever does the will of God is my brother and sister and mother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another time Jesus began to teach by the sea. Such a large crowd gathered around him that he got into a boat and sat in it out on the sea. The whole crowd was on the seashore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he taught them many things in parables. As he taught them, he said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen! There was a sower who went out to sow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he sowed, some seed fell along the path, and the birds came and ate it up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other seed fell on rocky ground, where it did not have much soil. It sprang up right away because it did not have deep soil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the sun rose, it was scorched, and because it did not have much root, it withered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some seed fell among the thorns, and the thorns grew up and choked it, so it did not produce fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Still other seed fell on good ground and yielded fruit, sprouting and growing and producing a crop: some thirty, some sixty, and some one hundred times as much as was sown.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said, “Whoever has ears to hear, let him hear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus was alone, those who were around him with the Twelve asked him about the parables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “The mystery of the kingdom of God has been given to you, but everything comes in parables to those who are outside,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that
they will certainly see but not perceive,
and they will certainly hear but not understand.
Otherwise, they might turn and be forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he asked them, “Do you not understand this parable? How then will you understand any of the parables?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sower sows the word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the ones along the path, where the word is sown. As soon as they hear it, Satan comes and immediately takes away the word that was sown in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some are like the ones sown on rocky ground: as soon as they hear the word, they immediately welcome it with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet since they have no root in themselves, they last only a short time. When trouble or persecution comes because of the word, they immediately fall away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Still others are sown among the thorns. These are the ones who hear the word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the worries of this life and the deceitfulness of wealth and desires for other things enter in and choke the word, so it becomes unfruitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the ones sown on the good ground are those who hear the word, accept it, and produce fruit: some thirty, some sixty, and some one hundred times as much as was sown.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also said to them, “A lamp is not brought out to be put under a basket or under a bed, is it? Isn’t it placed on a lampstand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there is nothing hidden that will not be revealed, and nothing concealed that will not come to light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went on to tell them, “Pay attention to what you hear. With the same measure you use, it will be measured to you, and more will be given to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, whoever has will be given more. And whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “The kingdom of God is like this: A man scatters seed on the ground,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and while he sleeps and rises, night and day, the seed sprouts and grows, though he does not know how.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ground produces fruit on its own: first the blade, then the head, then the full grain in the head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the crop is ready, he swings the sickle without delay, because the harvest has come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “To what should we compare the kingdom of God? Or with what parable may we picture it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like a mustard seed, which when sown on the ground is one of the smallest of all the seeds planted in the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet when it is planted, it grows up and becomes larger than all the garden plants and puts out large branches so that the birds of the sky can nest under its shade.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With many similar parables he continued to speak the word to them, as much as they were able to hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did not speak to them without a parable. But when he was alone with his disciples, he explained everything to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day, when evening came, Jesus said to them, “Let’s go over to the other side.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After leaving the crowd behind, the disciples took him along in the boat, just as he was. Other small boats also followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A great windstorm arose, and the waves were splashing into the boat, so that the boat was quickly filling up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus himself was in the stern, sleeping on a cushion. They woke him and said, “Teacher, don’t you care that we are about to drown?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he got up, rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, “Peace! Be still!” The wind stopped, and there was a great calm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Why are you so afraid? Do you still lack faith?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were filled with awe and said to one another, “Who then is this? Even the wind and the sea obey him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went to the other side of the sea, into the region of the Gerasenes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as Jesus stepped out of the boat, a man with an unclean spirit came out of the tombs to meet him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man lived in the tombs. Nobody could bind him anymore, not even with a chain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he had often been bound with shackles and chains, but he pulled the chains apart and broke the shackles in pieces. Nobody had the strength to subdue him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Night and day, in the tombs and in the mountains, he was constantly crying out and cutting himself with stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw Jesus from a distance, he ran and bowed down in front of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He cried out with a loud voice, “What do I have to do with you, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I beg you to swear by God not to torment me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Jesus had said to him, “Come out of the man, you unclean spirit!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus asked him, “What is your name?”
“My name is Legion,” he replied, “because we are many.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He begged Jesus repeatedly that he would not send them out of the region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a large herd of pigs there feeding on the hillside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The demons begged him, “Send us to the pigs so we may enter them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus gave them permission. The unclean spirits went out and entered the pigs. Then the herd of about two thousand pigs rushed down the steep bank into the sea and drowned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who were feeding the pigs ran and reported this in the city and the countryside.
People came to see what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to Jesus, they saw the man who had been possessed by the legion of demons sitting there clothed and in his right mind, and they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who had seen it described for these people what had happened to the demon-possessed man, and they told them about the pigs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began to plead with Jesus to leave their region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was getting into the boat, the man who had been demon-possessed begged to stay with Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus would not let him. Instead, he told him, “Go home to your people, and tell them everything the Lord has done for you and how he had mercy on you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man left and began to proclaim in the Decapolis everything Jesus had done for him. And everyone was amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had again crossed over in the boat to the other side, a large crowd gathered around him near the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of the synagogue rulers, named Jairus, came. When he saw Jesus, he fell at his feet
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and repeatedly pleaded with him, “My little daughter is near death. Please come and place your hands on her so that she may be healed and live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went with him, and a large crowd was following him, pressing tightly against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A certain woman who was there had a discharge of blood for twelve years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She had suffered much under the care of many physicians and had spent all that she had. Yet instead of getting better, she grew worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she heard what was being said about Jesus, she went up behind him in the crowd and touched his robe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said, “If I just touch his robe, I will be healed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately her flow of blood stopped, and she felt in her body that she was healed of her affliction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that moment, Jesus knew that power had gone out from him. He turned around in the crowd and asked, “Who touched my robe?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples said to him, “You see the crowd pressing tightly against you and yet you say, ‘Who touched me?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless he kept looking around to see who had done this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman was trembling with fear since she knew what had happened to her. She came forward, fell down in front of him, and told him the whole truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace and be healed of your suffering.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, people from the synagogue ruler’s house arrived, saying, “Your daughter is dead. Why bother the Teacher anymore?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus heard this report, he told the synagogue ruler, “Don’t be afraid. Only believe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did not allow anyone to follow him except Peter, James, and John the brother of James.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went into the house of the synagogue ruler, and Jesus saw a commotion with people weeping and wailing loudly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he entered, he said to them, “Why are you making a commotion and weeping? The child is not dead but sleeping.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They laughed at him. But after he put everyone out, he took the father of the child, her mother, and those who were with him and went in where the child was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grasping the hand of the child, he said to her, “Talitha, koum!” (When translated, that means, “Little girl, I say to you, arise!”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately the little girl stood up and began to walk around. (She was twelve years old.) They were completely and utterly amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he gave them strict orders not to let anyone know about this, and he told them to give her something to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus left there and went to his hometown. His disciples followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Sabbath came, he began to teach in the synagogue. Many who heard him were amazed. They asked, “Where did this man learn these things? What is this wisdom that has been given to this man? How is it that miracles such as these are performed by his hands?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isn’t this the carpenter, the son of Mary and the brother of James, Joses, Judas, and Simon? And aren’t his sisters here with us?” And they took offense at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor except in his hometown and among his own relatives and in his own house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He could not do any miracles there except to lay his hands on a few sick people and heal them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was amazed at their unbelief. Then he went around the villages teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called the Twelve and began to send them out two by two. He gave them authority over the unclean spirits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He instructed them to take nothing for their journey except a staff—no bread, no bag, no money in their money belts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were to put on sandals but not to wear two coats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Wherever you enter a house, stay there until you leave that area.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any place that will not receive you or listen to you, as you leave there, shake off the dust that is under your feet as a testimony against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went out and preached that people should repent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also drove out many demons. They anointed many sick people with oil and healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Herod heard about this because Jesus’ name had become well known. Herod was saying, “John the Baptizer has been raised from the dead! That is why these powers are at work in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But others were saying, “He is Elijah.” Still others were saying, “He is a prophet, like one of the prophets of old.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Herod heard this, he said, “This is John, the man I beheaded. He was raised.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it was Herod who had sent men to arrest John. He had him bound in prison because Herod had married Herodias, the wife of his brother Philip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, John had been telling him, “It is not lawful for you to have your brother’s wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herodias held a grudge against John and wanted to put him to death, but she could not,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because Herod feared John. He knew that John was a righteous and holy man, so he kept him safe. When Herod listened to John, he was perplexed in many ways, yet he gladly kept listening to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An opportune day came when it was Herod’s birthday. He gave a banquet for his nobles, the military officers, and the prominent men of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the daughter of Herodias came in and danced, she pleased Herod and his guests. The king said to the girl, “Ask me whatever you want, and I will give it to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With an oath he promised her, “Whatever you ask of me, I will give you, up to half of my kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She went out and said to her mother, “What should I ask for?”
Herodias said, “The head of John the Baptizer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The girl hurried right back to the king and made her request: “I want you to give me the head of John the Baptist on a platter right now.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king was very sad. But because of his oaths and his dinner guests, he did not want to refuse her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king sent an executioner at once and ordered him to bring John’s head. He went, beheaded John in prison,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: brought his head on a platter, and gave it to the girl. Then the girl gave it to her mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When John’s disciples heard about this, they came and took his body and laid it in a tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles gathered around Jesus and reported to him all that they had done and taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Come away by yourselves to a secluded place and rest a while.” For there were so many people coming and going that they did not even have a chance to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went away in the boat to a deserted place by themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many people saw them leave and knew where they were going. They ran there on foot from all the towns and arrived ahead of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus stepped out of the boat, he saw a large crowd. His heart went out to them because they were like sheep without a shepherd. He began to teach them many things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was already late in the day when his disciples came to him and said, “This is a deserted place and it is already very late.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send them away so they can go into the surrounding country and villages and buy themselves something to eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he answered them, “You give them something to eat.”
They asked him, “Should we go and buy two hundred denarii worth of bread and give them something to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to them, “How many loaves do you have? Go see.”
When they found out, they said, “Five, and two fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He directed everyone to sit down in groups on the green grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They sat down in groups of hundreds and fifties.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus took the five loaves and the two fish, looked up to heaven, and blessed the loaves and broke them. Then he kept giving pieces to his disciples to set in front of them. He also divided the two fish among them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all ate and were satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they picked up twelve basketfuls of broken pieces of bread and fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were five thousand men who ate the loaves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately Jesus made his disciples get into the boat and go ahead to the other side, to Bethsaida, while he himself dismissed the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had sent them off, he went up the mountain to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was evening, the boat was in the middle of the sea, and Jesus was alone on the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saw them straining at the oars, because the wind was against them. About the fourth watch of the night, he went to them, walking on the sea. He was ready to pass by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw him walking on the sea, they thought he was a ghost, and they cried out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all saw him and were terrified. Immediately he spoke with them and said, “Take courage! It is I. Do not be afraid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he climbed up into the boat with them, and the wind stopped. They were completely amazed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they had not understood about the loaves. Instead, their hearts were hardened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had crossed over, they landed at Gennesaret and anchored there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as they stepped out of the boat, people recognized Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They ran around that whole region and began to bring sick people on their stretchers to where they heard he was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherever he entered villages, cities, or the countryside, they were laying sick people in the marketplaces and pleading with him that they might just touch the edge of his garment. And all who touched it were made well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees and some of the experts in the law came from Jerusalem and gathered around Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They saw some of his disciples eating bread with unclean (that is, unwashed) hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, the Pharisees and all the Jews do not eat unless they scrub their hands with a fist, holding to the tradition of the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they come from the marketplace, they do not eat unless they wash. And there are many other traditions they adhere to, such as the washing of cups, pitchers, kettles, and dining couches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees and the experts in the law asked Jesus, “Why do your disciples not walk according to the tradition of the elders? Instead they eat bread with unclean hands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He answered them, “Isaiah was right when he prophesied about you hypocrites. As it is written:
These people honor me with their lips, but their heart is far from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They worship me in vain, teaching human rules as if they
    were doctrines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You abandon God’s commandment but hold to human tradition like the washing of pitchers and cups, and you do many other such things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He continued, “You have a fine way of setting aside God’s commandment to keep your own tradition.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For example, Moses said, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and ‘Whoever speaks evil of his father or mother must be put to death.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you say, ‘If a man tells his father or mother, “Whatever help you might have received from me is corban”’ (which means an offering),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you no longer let him do anything for his father or mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you nullify the word of God by your tradition that you have handed down. You do many things like that.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called the crowd to him again and said, “Everyone, listen to me and understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is nothing outside of a man that can make him unclean by going into him. But the things that come out of a man are what make a man unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had left the crowd and entered a house, his disciples asked him about this illustration.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Are you lacking in understanding too? Do you not understand that whatever goes into a man from the outside cannot make him unclean?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it does not enter his heart but goes into his stomach and goes out of him into the latrine—in this way all foods are purified.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He continued, “What comes out of a man, that is what makes a man unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, from within, out of people’s hearts, come evil thoughts, sexual sins, theft, murder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: adultery, greed, wickedness, deceit, unrestrained immorality, envy, slander, arrogance, and foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these evil things proceed from within and make a person unclean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus got up and went from there to the region of Tyre and Sidon. He entered a house and did not want anyone to know it, but he could not remain hidden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, when a woman whose little daughter had an unclean spirit heard about him, she immediately came and fell down at his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This woman was a Greek, of Syro-Phoenician origin. She asked him to drive the demon out of her daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Let the children be fed first, because it is not good to take the children’s bread and throw it to their little dogs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Lord,” she answered, “their little dogs under the table also eat some of the children’s crumbs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to her, “Because of this statement, go! The demon has gone out of your daughter.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She went home, found the child lying on the bed and the demon gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus left the region of Tyre again and went through Sidon to the Sea of Galilee, within the region of the Decapolis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought a man to him who was deaf and had a speech impediment. They pleaded with Jesus to place his hand on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus took him aside in private, away from the crowd. He put his fingers into the man’s ears. Then he spit and touched the man’s tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he looked up to heaven, he sighed and said, “Ephphatha!” (which means “Be opened!”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately the man’s ears were opened, his tongue was set free, and he began to speak plainly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus gave the people strict orders to tell no one, but the more he did so, the more they kept proclaiming it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were amazed beyond measure and said, “He has done everything well. He even makes the deaf hear and the mute speak!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days, when there was again a large crowd and they had nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples and said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I feel compassion for the crowd because they have already stayed with me three days and do not have anything to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I send them home hungry, they will faint on the way. Some of them have come from a long distance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples replied, “Where can anyone get enough bread to feed these people here in this deserted place?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked them, “How many loaves do you have?”
“Seven,” they said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He commanded the crowd to sit down on the ground. Then he took the seven loaves, gave thanks, and broke them. He gave the pieces to his disciples to distribute to the crowd, and they did so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also had a few small fish. He blessed them and said that these should be distributed as well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people ate and were satisfied. They picked up seven basketfuls of broken pieces that were left over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About four thousand men were there. Then he sent them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Right after that, Jesus got into the boat with his disciples and went to the region of Dalmanutha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees came and began to argue with him. To test him, they asked him for a sign from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sighed deeply in his spirit and said, “Why does this generation seek a sign? Amen I tell you: No such sign will be given to this generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he left them and got back into the boat, he crossed to the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had forgotten to take bread along except for one loaf that they had with them in the boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Watch out,” Jesus warned them. “Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and the yeast of Herod.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began discussing with one another the fact that they had no bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since Jesus knew this, he said to them, “Why are you discussing your lack of bread? Do you still not understand or comprehend? Do you have a hardened heart?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have eyes—do you not see? You have ears—do you not hear? Do you not remember?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I broke the five loaves for the five thousand, how many basketfuls of broken pieces did you pick up?”
“Twelve,” they told him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And when I broke the seven loaves for the four thousand, how many basketfuls of broken pieces did you pick up?”
“Seven,” they said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Do you still not comprehend?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Bethsaida, and some people brought him a blind man and begged him to touch him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took hold of the blind man’s hand and led him out of the village. When he had spit on his eyes, he placed his hands on him and asked him, “Do you see anything?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man looked up and said, “I see people. To me they look like trees walking.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus placed his hands on his eyes again. The man opened his eyes and his sight was restored. He could see everything clearly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sent him home, saying, “Do not go into the village.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went away with his disciples to the villages of Caesarea Philippi. On the way he asked his disciples, “Who do people say that I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told him, “John the Baptist; others say Elijah; and still others say one of the prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But who do you say I am?” he asked them.
Peter answered him, “You are the Christ.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he warned them not to tell anyone about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things; be rejected by the elders, the chief priests, and the experts in the law; be killed; and after three days rise again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was speaking plainly to them. Then Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after turning around and looking at his disciples, Jesus rebuked Peter and said, “Get behind me, Satan! You do not have your mind set on the things of God, but the things of men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called the crowd and his disciples together and said to them, “If anyone wants to follow me, let him deny himself, take up his cross, and follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it. But whoever loses his life for my sake, and for the sake of the gospel, will save it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After all, what good is it for a man to gain the whole world and yet forfeit his soul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or what can a man give in exchange for his soul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, whoever is ashamed of me and my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man will also be ashamed of him when he comes in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Amen I tell you: There are some standing here who will not taste death until they see the kingdom of God come with power.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After six days Jesus took Peter, James, and John with him and led them up a high mountain where they were alone by themselves. There he was transfigured in front of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His clothes became radiant, dazzling white, whiter than anyone on earth could bleach them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Elijah appeared to them together with Moses, and they were talking with Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to Jesus, “Rabbi, it is good for us to be here. Let us make three tents: one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did not know what to say because they were terrified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A cloud appeared and overshadowed them, and a voice came from the cloud, saying, “This is my Son, whom I love. Listen to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, when they looked around, they no longer saw anyone with them except Jesus alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were coming down the mountain, Jesus commanded them not to tell anyone what they had seen until the Son of Man had risen from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They kept the matter to themselves, discussing with one another what this “rising from the dead” meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him, “Why do the experts in the law say that Elijah must come first?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Elijah does come first and restores all things. Why was it also written about the Son of Man that he must suffer many things and be rejected?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I tell you that Elijah has come, and they did to him whatever they wanted, just as it was written about him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they returned to the other disciples, they saw a large crowd around them, and some experts in the law were arguing with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as all the people in the crowd saw Jesus, they were very excited and ran to greet him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked them, “What are you arguing about with them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One man from the crowd answered him, “Teacher, I brought you my son, who has a spirit that makes him unable to speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherever it seizes him, it throws him down, and he foams at the mouth, grinds his teeth, and becomes rigid. I asked your disciples to drive it out, but they could not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “O unbelieving generation,” Jesus replied. “How long will I be with you? How long will I put up with you? Bring him to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought the boy to Jesus. As soon as the spirit saw him, it threw the boy into a convulsion. He fell on the ground and rolled around, foaming at the mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus asked the boy’s father, “How long has this been happening to him?”
“From childhood,” he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It has often thrown him into the fire and into the water to kill him. But if you can do anything, have compassion on us and help us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you can?” Jesus said to him. “All things are possible for the one who believes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The child’s father immediately cried out and said with tears, “I do believe. Help me with my unbelief!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw that a crowd was quickly gathering, he rebuked the unclean spirit. “You mute and deaf spirit,” he said, “I command you to come out of him and never enter him again!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The spirit screamed, shook the boy violently, and came out. The boy looked so much like a corpse that many of them said, “He’s dead!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus took him by the hand, raised him up, and he stood up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus went into a house, his disciples asked him privately, “Why were we not able to drive it out?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “This kind cannot be driven out, except by prayer and fasting.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went on from there and passed through Galilee. He did not want anyone to know this,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he was teaching his disciples. He told them, “The Son of Man is going to be betrayed into the hands of men, and they will kill him. But three days after he is killed, he will rise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they did not understand the statement and were afraid to ask him about it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Capernaum. When he was in the house, he asked them, “What were you arguing about on the way?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they remained silent, because on the way they had argued with one another about who was the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sat down, called the Twelve, and said to them, “If anyone wants to be first, he will be the last of all and the servant of all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took a little child and placed him in their midst. Taking the child in his arms, he said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever welcomes one of these little children in my name welcomes me. And whoever welcomes me, welcomes not just me but also him who sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John said to him, “Teacher, we saw someone driving out demons in your name. We tried to stop him, because he was not following us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Do not try to stop him, because no one who does a miracle in my name will be able soon afterward to speak evil about me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever is not against us is for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amen I tell you: Whoever gives you a cup of water to drink in my name, because you belong to Christ, will certainly not lose his reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in me to fall into sin, it would be better for him if he were thrown into the sea with a large millstone hung around his neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your hand causes you to fall into sin, cut it off. It is better for you to enter life maimed, than to have two hands and go into hell, into the unquenchable fire,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘where their worm does not die, and the fire is not quenched.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your foot causes you to fall into sin, cut it off. It is better for you to enter life lame, than to have two feet and be thrown into hell,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘where their worm does not die, and the fire is not quenched.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your eye causes you to fall into sin, pluck it out. It is better for you to enter the kingdom of God with one eye, than to have two eyes and be thrown into hell,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘where their worm does not die, and the fire is not quenched.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For everyone will be salted with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salt is good. But if the salt loses its flavor, how will you make it salty again? Have salt in yourselves, and be at peace with one another.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus got up and went to the region of Judea beyond the Jordan. Crowds gathered around him again and, as he usually did, he taught them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some Pharisees came to test him and asked, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He replied, “What did Moses command you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Moses permitted a man to write a certificate of divorce and send her away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus told them, “He wrote this command for you because of your hard hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But from the beginning of creation, God made them male and female.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be joined to his wife,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the two will become one flesh. So they are no longer two but one flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, what God has joined together, let no one separate.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the house his disciples asked him about this again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Whoever divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery against her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If she divorces her husband and marries another, she commits adultery.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some people began bringing little children to Jesus so that he would touch them. But the disciples rebuked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw this, he was indignant. He said, “Let the little children come to me! Do not hinder them, because the kingdom of God belongs to such as these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amen I tell you: Whoever will not receive the kingdom of God like a little child will never enter it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took the little children in his arms, laid his hands on them, and blessed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was setting out on a journey, one man ran up to him and knelt in front of him. He asked, “Good teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Why do you call me good? No one is good except one—God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know the commandments. ‘You shall not murder. You shall not commit adultery. You shall not steal. You shall not give false testimony. You shall not defraud. Honor your father and mother.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man replied, “Teacher, I have kept all these since I was a child.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked at him, loved him, and said to him, “One thing you lack. Go, sell whatever you have, and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he heard this, he looked sad and went away grieving, because he had great wealth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked around and said to his disciples, “How hard it will be for those who have riches to enter the kingdom of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples were amazed at his words. But Jesus told them again, “Children, how hard it is for those who trust in their riches to enter the kingdom of God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were even more astonished and said to one another, “Who then can be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked at them and said, “For people, it is impossible, but not for God, because all things are possible for God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter began to say to him, “See, we have left everything and followed you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Amen I tell you: There is no one who has left home or brothers or sisters or mother or father or children or fields, for my sake and for the sake of the gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who now at this time will fail to receive one hundred times as much: houses, brothers, sisters, mothers, children, and fields (along with persecutions)—and in the coming age: eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many who are first will be last, and the last will be first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were on the road, going up to Jerusalem, and Jesus was leading them. The disciples were amazed, and the others who followed were afraid. He took the Twelve aside again and began to tell them what was going to happen to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Look, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be betrayed to the chief priests and the experts in the law. They will condemn him to death and will hand him over to the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will mock him, spit on him, flog him, and kill him. On the third day he will rise again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: James and John, the sons of Zebedee, approached him and said, “Teacher, we wish that you would do for us whatever we ask.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “What do you want me to do for you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “Promise that we may sit, one at your right and one at your left, in your glory.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to them, “You do not know what you are asking. Can you drink the cup that I am going to drink or be baptized with the baptism that I am going to be baptized with?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“We can,” they replied.
Jesus told them, “You will drink the cup that I am going to drink and be baptized with the baptism that I am going to be baptized with.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to sit at my right or at my left is not for me to give; rather, these places belong to those for whom they have been prepared.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the ten heard this, they were angry with James and John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called them together and said, “You know that those who are considered rulers over the Gentiles lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that is not the way it is to be among you. Instead, whoever wants to be great among you will be your servant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and whoever wants to be first among you will be a slave of all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Jericho. As Jesus and his disciples and a large crowd were leaving Jericho, a blind man, Bartimaeus the son of Timaeus, was sitting by the road begging.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he heard that it was Jesus the Nazarene, he began to shout, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many told him to be quiet, but he kept shouting all the more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus stopped and said, “Call him.”
They called the blind man, saying, “Cheer up! Get up. He is calling you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He tossed aside his outer garment, jumped up, and went to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What do you want me to do for you?” Jesus asked him.
The blind man replied, “Rabboni, I want to see again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “Go. Your faith has made you well.” Immediately he received his sight and began following Jesus on the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they approached Jerusalem, at Bethphage and Bethany, on the Mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and told them, “Go into the village ahead of you. As soon as you enter it, you will find a colt tied there, on which no one has ever sat. Untie it and bring it here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you doing this?’ say, ‘The Lord needs it, and he will send it back here without delay.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left and found a colt on the street, tied at a door; and they untied it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some who were standing there asked them, “What are you doing, untying that colt?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples answered them just as Jesus had instructed them, and the men let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought the colt to Jesus, threw their garments on it, and Jesus sat on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many people spread their garments on the road. Others spread branches that they had cut from the fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who went in front and those who followed were crying out,
Hosanna!
Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the coming kingdom of our father David!
Hosanna in the highest!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went into the temple courts in Jerusalem and looked around at everything. Since it was already late, he went out to Bethany with the Twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, after they had set out from Bethany, Jesus was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw a fig tree in leaf in the distance, he went to see if he might find anything on it. When he came to it, he found nothing but leaves, since it was not the season for figs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to it, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again!” And his disciples were listening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Jerusalem. Jesus went into the temple area and began to drive out those who were selling and buying in the temple courts. He overturned the tables of the money changers and the chairs of those who were selling doves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He would not allow anyone to carry any merchandise through the temple courts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He began to teach them: “Is it not written: ‘My house will be called a house of prayer for all nations’? But you have made it ‘a den of robbers’!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests and the experts in the law heard this and were looking for a way to kill him. Indeed they were afraid of him, because the whole crowd was amazed at his teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening came, Jesus and his disciples would leave the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they passed by in the morning, they saw the fig tree withered down to the roots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter remembered and said, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree that you cursed has withered.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Have faith in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amen I tell you: Whoever says to this mountain, ‘Be lifted up and thrown into the sea,’ and does not doubt in his heart, but believes that what he says will happen, it will be done for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I tell you, everything that you ask for in prayer, believe that you have received it, and it will be yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever you stand praying, if you have anything against anyone, forgive him, so that your Father in heaven may forgive you your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you do not forgive, your Father in heaven will not forgive your sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went into Jerusalem again. As he was walking in the temple courts, the chief priests, the experts in the law, and the elders came to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him, “By what authority are you doing these things? Or who gave you this authority to do these things?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “I will ask you one question. Answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I am doing these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The baptism of John—was it from heaven or from men? Answer me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They discussed this with one another, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Then why did you not believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we say, ‘From men’. . . .” (They feared the crowd, because everybody held that John really was a prophet.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they answered Jesus, “We don’t know.”
Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus began to speak to them in parables. “A man planted a vineyard, put a fence around it, dug a pit for the winepress, and built a watchtower. Then he rented it out to some tenant farmers and went on a journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was time, he sent a servant to the tenants to receive his share of the vineyard’s produce.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took him, beat him, and sent him away empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, he sent another servant to them. But they hit him on the head and treated him shamefully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he sent another servant, but they killed that one. He also sent many others; some they beat, and others they killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He still had one left, a dearly loved son. Finally, he sent him to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those tenant farmers said to one another, ‘This is the heir. Come on, let’s kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They seized him, killed him, and threw him out of the vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So what will the owner of the vineyard do? He will come and kill those tenant farmers and give the vineyard to others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you not read this Scripture:
The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord has done this, and it is marvelous in our eyes?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were looking for a way to arrest him, because they knew that he had spoken the parable against them. But they feared the crowd, so they left him and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jewish leaders sent some Pharisees and some Herodians to Jesus to try to trap him in what he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came and said to him, “Teacher, we know that you are honest and do not play favorites, since you are not partial to anyone, but you teach the way of God on the basis of the truth. Is it lawful to pay a tax to Caesar or not?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should we pay it or not?”
Since Jesus knew their hypocrisy, he said to them, “Why do you keep testing me? Bring me a denarius so that I can look at it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they brought one.
He said to them, “Whose image and inscription is this?”
“Caesar’s,” they answered him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Jesus told them, “Give to Caesar what is Caesar’s, and to God what is God’s.”
And they were amazed at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next some Sadducees (who say that there will be no resurrection) came to him. They asked him a question:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher, Moses wrote for us: ‘If a man’s brother dies and leaves behind a wife but no child, then his brother should take his wife and raise up children for his brother.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now there were seven brothers. The first one took a wife and died without leaving children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second one married her and died, leaving no children. The third one did the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seven left no children. Last of all, the woman also died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they rise in the resurrection, whose wife will she be, since all seven had her as a wife?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Isn’t this the reason you are mistaken: that you do not know the Scriptures or the power of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, when people rise from the dead, they do not marry, and they are not given in marriage, but they are like angels in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But about the dead—that they are raised—have you not read in the book of Moses, in the passage about the burning bush, how God told him, ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living. You are badly mistaken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the experts in the law approached after he heard their discussion. When he saw that Jesus had answered them well, he asked Jesus, “Which commandment is the greatest of all?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “The most important is: ‘Hear, O Israel, the Lord, our God, the Lord is one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your mind, and with all your strength.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second is this: ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The expert in the law said to him, “Well said, teacher. You have spoken correctly on the basis of the truth that he is one, and there is no other besides him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To love him with all your heart, with all your understanding, and with all your strength, and to love your neighbor as yourself, is more important than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw that he had answered wisely, he said to him, “You are not far from the kingdom of God.” After that, no one dared to ask him any more questions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Jesus was teaching in the temple courts, he responded by saying, “How is it that the experts in the law say that the Christ is the Son of David?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David himself said by the Holy Spirit:
The Lord said to my Lord, ‘Sit at my right hand,
until I make your enemies a footstool under your feet.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “David himself calls him Lord, so how can he be his son?” The large crowd listened to him with delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also said to them in his teaching, “Beware of the experts in the law who like to walk around in long robes and receive greetings in the marketplaces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They love the best seats in the synagogues and the places of honor at banquets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They devour widows’ houses and offer long prayers to look good. These men will receive greater condemnation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sat down opposite the offering box and was watching how the crowd put money into it. Many rich people put in large amounts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One poor widow came and put in two small bronze coins, worth less than a penny.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called his disciples together and said to them, “Amen I tell you: This poor widow put more into the offering box than all the others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they all gave out of their surplus, but she, out of her poverty, put in everything—all that she had to live on.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was leaving the temple courts, one of his disciples said to him, “Teacher, look what impressive stones these are, and what impressive buildings!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Do you see these large buildings? There will not be one stone here left on top of another. They will all be thrown down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was sitting on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked him privately,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell us, when will these things happen, and what will be the sign when all these things are about to be fulfilled?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus began by telling them, “Be careful that no one deceives you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am he,’ and will deceive many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whenever you hear of wars and rumors of wars, do not be troubled. Such things must happen, but the end is not yet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places. There will be famines. These are the beginning of birth pains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But be on your guard! People will hand you over to councils, and you will be beaten in synagogues. You will stand in the presence of rulers and kings for my sake as a witness to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the gospel must first be preached to all the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever they arrest you and hand you over, do not worry beforehand what you should say. Say whatever is given to you in that hour, because you will not be the ones speaking; instead it will be the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Brother will betray brother to death, and a father, his child. Children will rise up against their parents and put them to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be hated by everyone because of my name, but the one who endures to the end will be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you see the abomination that causes desolation standing where it should not be—let the reader understand—then those who are in Judea should flee to the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who is on the housetop should not go down or enter to take anything out of his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who is in the field should not return to get his clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How terrible it will be for those who are pregnant and those who are nursing babies in those days!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pray that this will not happen in winter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in those days there will be distress of such a kind as has not happened from the beginning of the creation until now, and surely never will be again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the Lord had not shortened those days, no one would be saved. But for the sake of the elect, whom he has chosen, he has shortened the days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then if someone tells you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or, ‘Look, there he is!’ do not believe it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For false Christs and false prophets will rise up and perform signs and wonders to deceive even the elect, if it were possible.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So be on your guard. I have told you everything in advance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But after that distress in those days, the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The stars will be falling from the sky, and the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator
