verses.text: Then you will see the Son of Man coming on clouds with great power and glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time he will send out his angels and gather his elect from the four winds, from the farthest end of the earth to the farthest end of the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Learn from this illustration of the fig tree: Whenever its branch becomes tender and sprouts leaves, you know that summer is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So also when you see these things happening, you will know that he is near—at the doors!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amen I tell you: This generation will certainly not pass away until all these things happen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one knows about that day or hour, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch! Be alert and pray, because you do not know when the time will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like a man going away on a journey. When he left his home, he put his servants in charge and assigned what each one was to do. He also commanded the doorkeeper to keep watch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore keep watch, because you do not know when the owner of the house is coming: whether in the evening, or at midnight, or when the rooster crows, or early in the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he comes suddenly, do not let him find you sleeping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What I say to you, I say to everyone: Keep watch!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was two days before the Passover and the Festival of Unleavened Bread. The chief priests and the experts in the law were looking for some deceptive way to arrest Jesus and kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Certainly not during the Festival,” they said, “or there will be a riot among the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper, as he was reclining at the table, a woman came with an alabaster jar of very expensive perfume, made from pure nard. She broke the alabaster jar and poured it over his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there were some who were indignant and said to one another, “Why has this perfume been wasted?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Certainly this perfume could have been sold for more than three hundred denarii and given to the poor!” And they began to scold her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Leave her alone. Why are you bothering her? She has done a beautiful thing for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, you always have the poor with you, and whenever you want, you can do good for them. But you are not always going to have me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She did what she could. She anointed my body beforehand for burial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amen I tell you: Wherever the gospel is preached in the whole world, what this woman did will also be told in memory of her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas Iscariot, one of the Twelve, went to the chief priests in order to betray Jesus to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard this, they were glad and promised to give him money. So he began to look for an opportunity to betray him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day of the Festival of Unleavened Bread, when the Passover lamb is sacrificed, his disciples asked him, “Where do you want us to go and prepare for you to eat the Passover?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent two of his disciples and said to them, “Go into the city, and there a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherever he enters, tell the owner of the house that the Teacher says, ‘Where is my guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will show you a large upper room, furnished and ready. Make preparations for us there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples left and went into the city and found things just as he had told them; and they prepared the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was evening, he arrived with the Twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were reclining and eating, Jesus said, “Amen I tell you: One of you will betray me, one who is eating with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began to be sorrowful and said to him one by one, “Surely not I?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “It is one of the Twelve, one who is dipping bread with me in the dish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, the Son of Man is going to go just as it has been written about him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would have been better for that man if he had not been born.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were eating, Jesus took bread. When he had blessed it, he broke it and gave it to them, saying, “Take it. This is my body.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took the cup, gave thanks, and gave it to them. They all drank from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “This is my blood of the new testament, which is poured out for many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amen I tell you: I will certainly not drink again of the fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they sang a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “You will all fall away because of me. For it is written: ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after I am raised, I will go ahead of you into Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said to him, “Even if all fall away, I will not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Amen I tell you: Today—this very night—before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter kept saying emphatically, “Even if I have to die with you, I will never deny you.” And they all said the same thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went to a place named Gethsemane. Jesus told his disciples, “Sit here while I pray.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took Peter, James, and John along with him and began to be troubled and distressed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “My soul is overwhelmed with sorrow, even to the point of death. Stay here and keep watch.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Going forward a little, he fell on the ground and prayed that, if it were possible, the hour might pass from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also said, “Abba, Father, everything is possible for you. Take this cup away from me. Yet not what I will, but what you will.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he returned to the disciples, he found them sleeping. He said to Peter, “Simon, are you sleeping? Were you not strong enough to keep watch for one hour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch and pray that you may not enter into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he went away and prayed, saying the same thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he returned, he found them sleeping, for their eyes were heavy. They did not know what they should answer him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He returned the third time and said to them, “Are you going to continue sleeping and resting? It is enough. The hour has come. Look, the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rise, let us go. Look, my betrayer is near.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just then, while he was still speaking, Judas, one of the Twelve, arrived. A crowd was with him, armed with swords and clubs. They were from the chief priests, the experts in the law, and the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now his betrayer had given them a signal, saying, “The one I kiss is the man. Arrest him and lead him away under guard.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went right to Jesus and said, “Rabbi!” and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They laid hands on him and arrested him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one of those who stood nearby drew his sword, struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus responded by saying to them, “Have you come out with swords and clubs to capture me as you would a criminal?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Day after day I was with you, teaching in the temple courts, and you did not arrest me. But this happened so that the Scriptures may be fulfilled.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples all left him and fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A certain young man was following him, wearing just a linen cloth over his naked body. They seized him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he left behind the linen cloth and fled from them naked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They led Jesus away to the high priest. All the chief priests, the elders, and the experts in the law gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter followed him at a distance, right into the courtyard of the high priest. He was sitting with the guards and warming himself at the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were looking for testimony against Jesus in order to put him to death, but they did not find any.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many testified falsely against him, but their testimonies did not agree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some stood up and gave this false testimony against him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We heard him say, ‘I will destroy this temple made with hands, and in three days I will build another made without hands.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet even on this point, their testimony did not agree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The high priest stepped forward and questioned Jesus, “Have you no answer? What is this they are testifying against you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Jesus was silent and did not answer anything.
Again the high priest asked him, “Are you the Christ, the Son of the Blessed One?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am,” Jesus said. “And you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of power and coming with the clouds of heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The high priest tore his robes and said, “Why do we need any more witnesses?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have heard the blasphemy! What do you think?”
They all condemned him as being worthy of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some began to spit on him. They covered his face and struck him with their fists, saying, “Prophesy!” The guards also took him and beat him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Peter was in the courtyard below, one of the servant girls of the high priest came there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she saw Peter warming himself, she looked directly at him and said, “You were also with the Nazarene, Jesus!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he denied it, saying, “I don’t know or understand what you are saying,” and he went out to the entryway. Then a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the servant girl saw him, once more she began to tell those standing there, “This is one of them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But again he denied it. After a little while those who were standing there said to Peter, “Surely you are one of them, because you are a Galilean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he began to curse and to swear, “I do not know this man you are talking about!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just then, the rooster crowed for the second time. Then Peter remembered what Jesus had said to him: “Before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.” And he broke down and wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as it was morning, the chief priests, along with the elders, the experts in the law, and the whole Sanhedrin, reached a decision. They bound Jesus, led him away, and handed him over to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?”
He answered him, “It is as you say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests accused him of many things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate questioned him again, “Are you not going to answer anything? See how many charges they are bringing against you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus still did not answer anything, so Pilate was amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At each Festival, Pilate used to release to the people one prisoner whom they requested.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was one named Barabbas, who was imprisoned with the rebels and had committed murder in the rebellion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd came up and began to ask Pilate to do for them what he usually did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate replied, “Do you want me to release the King of the Jews to you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, he knew that it was because of envy that the chief priests had handed him over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the chief priests stirred up the crowd to have him release Barabbas to them instead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, Pilate replied to them, “Then what do you want me to do with the man you call the King of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Crucify him!” they shouted back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Pilate said to them, “Why? What has he done wrong?”
But they shouted even louder, “Crucify him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since he wanted to satisfy the crowd, Pilate released Barabbas to them. After he had Jesus flogged, he handed him over to be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers led him away inside the palace, which is the Praetorium, and called together the whole cohort of soldiers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They put a purple robe on him, twisted together a crown of thorns, and put it on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers began to salute him, “Hail, King of the Jews!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They kept hitting him on the head with a reed and spitting on him. They also kneeled down to pay homage to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had mocked him, they took off the purple robe and put his own clothing on him. Then they led him out to crucify him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A certain man, Simon of Cyrene (the father of Alexander and Rufus), was passing by on his way in from the country. They forced him to carry Jesus’ cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought Jesus to the place called Golgotha, which means, “The place of a skull.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They tried to give him wine mixed with myrrh, but he did not take it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They crucified him. And they divided his garments, casting lots for them to decide what each of them would take.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was the third hour when they crucified him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The superscription stating the charge against him read, “The King of the Jews.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also crucified two criminals with him, one on his right and one on his left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who passed by ridiculed him, shaking their heads and saying, “Ha! You who are going to destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: save yourself! Come down from the cross!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, the chief priests along with the experts in the law mocked him among themselves. “He saved others,” they said. “He cannot save himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the Christ, the King of Israel, come down now from the cross so that we may see and believe!”
Those who were crucified with him also insulted him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was the sixth hour, darkness came over the whole land until the ninth hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the ninth hour Jesus shouted with a loud voice, “Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani?” which means, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When some of those standing there heard this, they said, “Listen, he’s calling Elijah!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Someone ran, filled a sponge with sour wine, put it on a stick, and gave it to him to drink. They said, “Leave him alone. Let’s see if Elijah comes to take him down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus cried out with a loud voice and breathed his last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The curtain of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the centurion who stood facing him saw how he cried out and breathed his last, he said, “Truly this man was the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were also women watching from a distance. Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James the younger and of Joses, and Salome.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he was in Galilee, they followed him and served him. Many other women also came up with him to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was already evening, and since it was Preparation Day (that is, the day before the Sabbath),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph from Arimathea, a prominent member of the Council, who was himself waiting for the kingdom of God, boldly went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate was surprised that he was already dead. He summoned the centurion and asked him if Jesus had been dead for a long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he learned from the centurion that it was so, he granted the body to Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph bought a linen cloth, took him down, and wrapped him in the linen cloth. He laid him in a tomb that had been cut out of rock, and he rolled a stone against the entrance of the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses were watching where the body was laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought spices so they could go and anoint Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Very early on the first day of the week, at sunrise, they went to the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were saying to each other, “Who will roll the stone away from the entrance to the tomb for us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they looked up, they saw that the stone, which was very large, had been rolled away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they entered the tomb, they saw a young man dressed in a white robe sitting on the right side, and they were alarmed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Do not be alarmed. You are looking for Jesus the Nazarene, who was crucified. He has risen! He is not here. See the place where they laid him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But go, tell his disciples and Peter, ‘He is going ahead of you into Galilee. There you will see him, just as he told you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went out and hurried away from the tomb, trembling and perplexed. They said nothing to anyone, because they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus had risen early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, out of whom he had driven seven demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She went and reported to those who had been with him, as they mourned and wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard that he was alive and had been seen by her, they did not believe it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things, Jesus appeared in another form to two of them as they were walking along on their way to the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These two also returned and reported it to the rest. But they did not believe them either.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, he appeared to the Eleven themselves as they were reclining at the table. He rebuked them for their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they did not believe those who had seen him after he had risen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Go into all the world and preach the gospel to all creation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever believes and is baptized will be saved, but whoever does not believe will be condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These signs will accompany those who believe: In my name they will drive out demons. They will speak in new languages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will pick up snakes. And if they drink any deadly poison, it will not harm them. They will lay their hands on the sick, and they will get well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord Jesus, after he had spoken to them, was taken up into heaven and sat down at the right hand of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who went out preached everywhere, while the Lord worked with them and confirmed his word by the signs that accompanied it.
verses.speaker: Narrator
